results.title: Sport and coaching
results.creator_credit: Tom Trikojus and Video Education Australasia
results.brief_description: This program covers the specific coaching skills, different styles and characteristics of a respected coach. Can they understand how to cater for different skill levels from the beginner through to the skilled athlete? The following topics relating to caching are covered: motivation to become a coach; philosophies of coaching; safety - the coaches’ role; planning and goal setting; physiological development of athletes; psychological aspects; management and administration duties; competition day - role of the coach; accreditation requirements for coaching; coaching and its unique challenges; coaches and athletes, the athletes’ view. Support notes available. Suitable for Lower-Upper Secondary level students.

results.title: Spook sport
results.creator_credit: Norman McLaren, Mary-Ellen Bute, Creative Film Society and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An expressionistic interpretation of “Danse macabre” by Camille Saint-Saens. Conventional cel animation and pen drawings were done by Norman McLaren directly on 35 mm film stock.

results.title: Splendour in the grass
results.creator_credit: Elia Kazan and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Deanie (Natalie Wood) is a beautiful teenager eager to do what is right in her staunchly moral hometown, in the 1920’s but the emotions she shares with her boyfriend, Bud (Warren Beatty) are too strong to ignore. Eventually the conflict between what society expects and what their desires demand pushes Bud to physical collapse and Deanie to madness. The young stars bring freshness and intensity to this story of parental domination, moral codes and young love, directed with insight and power by Elia Kazan.
